clusters.title: Man sprays Rep. Ilhan Omar with unknown substance at town hall
clusters.neutral_headline: Minnesota Representative Ilhan Omar attacked during town hall meeting

items.title: Man sprays Rep. Ilhan Omar with unknown substance at town hall
items.standfirst: Rep. Ilhan Omar was calling for the abolishment of ICE and for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to resign when a man sitting in the front row rushed up and sprayed her. He was arrested and Omar was not injured, police said.
items.content: Rep. Ilhan Omar was calling for the abolishment of ICE and for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to resign when a man sitting in the front row rushed up and sprayed her. He was arrested and Omar was not injured, police said.

items.title: Minnesota congresswoman Ilhan Omar attacked with 'unknown liquid' during town hall
items.standfirst: Omar was uninjured and continued to speak at the event following the incident.
items.content: Omar was uninjured and continued to speak at the event following the incident.

items.title: Man sprays Omar with unknown liquid during town hall

items.content: A man lunged at United States Democratic Congresswoman Ilhan Omar and sprayed her with an unknown substance from a syringe during a town hall in Minneapolis before being tackled by security.The incide...

items.content: Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar was speaking at a town hall event when she was rushed by a man who sprayed a liquid at her via a syringe. (Image credit: OCTAVIO JONES/AFP via Getty Images)

items.content: Video shows the protester jump out of his seat and charge at Omar before appearing to throw a substance on her.

items.content: Omar was sprayed with an unknown substance during the attack by a man, who was then tackled to the ground.

items.title: Man charges at Rep. Ilhan Omar and sprays her with unknown substance during Minneapolis town hall

items.content: Warning: This video contains some profanity. A man sprayed Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar of Minnesota with an unknown substance during her town hall in Minneapolis on Tuesday night. He was immediately apprehended, and Omar continued the event.

items.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics

items.title: ICE role at the Winter Olympics prompts fury in Italy

items.content: Italian officials reacted with anger at the news that a part of ICE, Homeland Security Investigations, will play a role in Olympic security next month.

items.title: ICE agents to have role at Winter Olympics - but told they are 'not welcome'

items.content: ICE agents will have a security role at the Winter Olympics in Italy, it has been revealed, after the man who led the Trump administration's crackdown in Minneapolis was moved out of the city.

items.title: One of the benefits of being an active grandparent? Slower cognitive decline
items.standfirst: A new study of grandparents found that those who take care of grandchildren score better on tests of memory and language, and decline more slowly, than those who do not. "CBS Evening News" anchor Tony Dokoupil called his mom for her reaction.
items.content: A new study of grandparents found that those who take care of grandchildren score better on tests of memory and language, and decline more slowly, than those who do not. "CBS Evening News" anchor Tony Dokoupil called his mom for her reaction.

items.title: TikTok settles landmark social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial
items.standfirst: TikTok has agreed to settle a major lawsuit claiming its platform deliberately addicted and harmed children, just days before the trial was set to begin. The case, which also involves Meta’s Instagram, Google’s YouTube and Snap, could influence hundreds of similar lawsuits targeting social media companies over youth mental health and safety.
items.content: TikTok has agreed to settle a major lawsuit claiming its platform deliberately addicted and harmed children, just days before the trial was set to begin. The case, which also involves Meta’s Instagram, Google’s YouTube and Snap, could influence hundreds of similar lawsuits targeting social media companies over youth mental health and safety.

items.title: TikTok settles just before social media addiction trial to begin
items.standfirst: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, and YouTube parent Google.
items.content: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, and YouTube parent Google.

items.title: TikTok Joins Snap Settling Youth Addiction Suit Before Trial
items.standfirst: TikTok is moving to settle a lawsuit with a woman who alleged that the company and other social media giants designed their platforms to addict young users, the first such case to go to trial.
items.content: TikTok is moving to settle a lawsuit with a woman who alleged that the company and other social media giants designed their platforms to addict young users, the first such case to go to trial.

The deal, nearly two decades in the making, will see India lower tariffs in two of its most politically sensitive sectors, agriculture…

items.title: Sensitive agricultural products excluded from EU - India trade deal
items.standfirst: The EU and India have hailed their new free trade agreement as "the mother of all deals". While the pact eliminates or significantly reduces tariffs on a vast majority of goods traded between the two, it excludes politically sensitive farming products. We'll take a closer look. Also in the segment, some Cypriot fishermen have taken their battle against invasive fish to the dinner table.
items.content: The EU and India have hailed their new free trade agreement as "the mother of all deals". While the pact eliminates or significantly reduces tariffs on a vast majority of goods traded between the two, it excludes politically sensitive farming products. We'll take a closer look. Also in the segment, some Cypriot fishermen have taken their battle against invasive fish to the dinner table.

clusters.title: French former senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault her
clusters.neutral_headline: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP

items.title: French former senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault her
items.standfirst: Joël Guerriau sentenced to four years in prison after spiking lawmaker’s champagne with ecstasyA French court has found a former senator guilty of drugging a female lawmaker with ecstasy with intent to sexually assault her.Joël Guerriau, 68, was sentenced to four years in prison on Tuesday, of which 18 months must be behind bars.In the UK, Rape Crisis offers support for rape and sexual abuse on 0808 802 9999 in England and Wales, 0808 801 0302 in Scotland, or 0800 0246 991 in Northern Ireland. In the US, Rainn offers support on 800-656-4673. In Australia, support is available at 1800Respect (1800 737 732). Other international helplines can be found at ibiblio.org/rcip/internl.html Continue reading...
items.content: Joël Guerriau sentenced to four years in prison after spiking lawmaker’s champagne with ecstasyA French court has found a former senator guilty of drugging a female lawmaker with ecstasy with intent to sexually assault her.Joël Guerriau, 68, was sentenced to four years in prison on Tuesday, of which 18 months must be behind bars.In the UK, Rape Crisis offers support for rape and sexual abuse on 0808 802 9999 in England and Wales, 0808 801 0302 in Scotland, or 0800 0246 991 in Northern Ireland. In the US, Rainn offers support on 800-656-4673. In Australia, support is available at 1800Respect (1800 737 732). Other international helplines can be found at ibiblio.org/rcip/internl.html Continue reading...

items.title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP
items.standfirst: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.
items.content: Joel Guerriau received a four-year prison sentence, 18 months of which are to be served behind bars.

items.title: French ex-senator found guilty of spiking MP's drink to sexually assault her
items.standfirst: A French court on Tuesday found former senator Joel Guerriau guilty of spiking lawmaker Sandrine Josso's champagne in November 2023 in order to sexually abuse her. The court sentenced him to four years in prison, of which 18 months must be behind bars.
items.content: A French court on Tuesday found former senator Joel Guerriau guilty of spiking lawmaker Sandrine Josso's champagne in November 2023 in order to sexually abuse her. The court sentenced him to four years in prison, of which 18 months must be behind bars.

items.title: Major incident declared in Somerset after Storm Chandra brings flooding and strong winds
items.standfirst: South-west England bears brunt of storm, but yellow weather warnings are also issued for Wales, Northern Ireland and ScotlandA major incident has been declared in Somerset after swathes of south-west England were left flooded and cut off by Storm Chandra.The heavy rain and strong winds prompted calls for more resources to be invested in making the region more resilient in extreme weather. Continue reading...

Homan met with the city’s mayor and the Minnesota governor amid growing political pressure and public outrage.

items.standfirst: The families of two men allegedly killed in a boat strike cited a law enacted over 100 years ago in a wrongful death lawsuit against the United States. items.title: Tech Stocks Lead Charge Toward Record | Bloomberg Tech 1/27/2026
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss stocks closing in on record highs driven by tech shares with earnings imminent. Plus, Bridgit Mendler, CEO and co-founder of Northwood, discusses the company’s $100 million Series B to modernize space infrastructure on Earth. And Amazon is shuttering its physical stores, doubling down on deliveries. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss stocks closing in on record highs driven by tech shares with earnings imminent. Plus, Bridgit Mendler, CEO and co-founder of Northwood, discusses the company’s $100 million Series B to modernize space infrastructure on Earth. And Amazon is shuttering its physical stores, doubling down on deliveries. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Specialized AI Opens New Investment Opportunities: Sequoia’s Buhler
items.standfirst: Sequoia Partner Konstantine Buhler discusses opportunities in artificial specialized intelligence. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Sequoia Partner Konstantine Buhler discusses opportunities in artificial specialized intelligence. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Driverless Trucking Firm Gatik Signs Major $600M Deal
items.standfirst: Autonomous trucking company Gatik says it has brought in more than $600 million in contracted revenue. Gatik CEO and co-founder Gautam Narang discusses what comes next for the company with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Autonomous trucking company Gatik says it has brought in more than $600 million in contracted revenue. Gatik CEO and co-founder Gautam Narang discusses what comes next for the company with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Bridgit Mendler’s Northwood Raises $100M Series B
items.standfirst: Northwood, the maker of ground infrastructure for the space industry, has closed a $100 million Series B, led by Washington Harbour Partners. Bridgit Mendler, CEO and co-founder of Northwood, discusses the demand driving this funding round. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Northwood, the maker of ground infrastructure for the space industry, has closed a $100 million Series B, led by Washington Harbour Partners. Bridgit Mendler, CEO and co-founder of Northwood, discusses the demand driving this funding round. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: A crackdown on immigration is leading to a sharp drop in U.S. population growth
items.standfirst: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year.
items.content: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year. (Image credit: John Moore)

items.title: Bitter cold grips the eastern U.S. as storm deaths rise and power outages linger

clusters.title: Russian drone strike on Ukrainian passenger train kills five
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian drone strike on Ukrainian passenger train kills five

items.title: Russian drone strike on Ukrainian passenger train kills five
items.standfirst: Attack in Kharkiv region was denounced as terrorism by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said it undermined ‘efforts to end the war’A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in north-eastern Ukraine has killed five people, prosecutors said, an attack denounced as terrorism by president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.Prosecutors said fragments of five bodies had been found at the scene of the strike on the train, which occurred on Tuesday near a village in Ukraine’s Kharkiv region. Continue reading...
items.content: Attack in Kharkiv region was denounced as terrorism by Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said it undermined ‘efforts to end the war’A Russian drone strike on a passenger train in north-eastern Ukraine has killed five people, prosecutors said, an attack denounced as terrorism by president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.Prosecutors said fragments of five bodies had been found at the scene of the strike on the train, which occurred on Tuesday near a village in Ukraine’s Kharkiv region. Continue reading...

items.content: At least four people were killed when drones targeted a packed train in north-eastern Ukraine, officials say.

clusters.title: Anger as branch of ICE to help with security at Winter Olympics in Italy
clusters.neutral_headline: Anger as branch of ICE to help with security at Winter Olympics in Italy

items.title: Anger as branch of ICE to help with security at Winter Olympics in Italy
items.standfirst: A branch of the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) will help with security for the Winter Olympics in Italy, it confirmed Tuesday, sparking anger and warnings they were not welcome. Reports had been circulating for days that the agency embroiled in an often brutal immigration crackdown in the United States could be involved in US security measures for the February 6-22 Games in northern Italy.
items.content: A branch of the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) will help with security for the Winter Olympics in Italy, it confirmed Tuesday, sparking anger and warnings they were not welcome. Reports had been circulating for days that the agency embroiled in an often brutal immigration crackdown in the United States could be involved in US security measures for the February 6-22 Games in northern Italy.

items.title: ‘A militia that kills’: uproar in Italy over ICE security role at Winter Olympics
items.standfirst: Milan mayor says agents ‘not welcome’ in co-host city and Italy can take care of security itselfA unit of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents will have a security role in the Winter Olympic Games in Italy, sparking uproar and petitions against the deployment.Sources at the US embassy in Rome confirmed a statement from ICE, the agency embroiled in a brutal immigration crackdown in the US, saying that federal agents would support diplomatic security details during the Milan-Cortina Games but would not run any enforcement operations. Continue reading...
items.content: Milan mayor says agents ‘not welcome’ in co-host city and Italy can take care of security itselfA unit of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents will have a security role in the Winter Olympic Games in Italy, sparking uproar and petitions against the deployment.Sources at the US embassy in Rome confirmed a statement from ICE, the agency embroiled in a brutal immigration crackdown in the US, saying that federal agents would support diplomatic security details during the Milan-Cortina Games but would not run any enforcement operations. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Spain approves decree to regularise half a million undocumented migrants
clusters.neutral_headline: Spain approves decree to regularise half a million undocumented migrants

items.title: Spain approves decree to regularise half a million undocumented migrants
items.standfirst: Move affecting those who have been in Spain five months or more runs counter to anti-migration policies across Europe Spain’s socialist-led coalition government has approved a decree it said would regularise 500,000 undocumented migrants and asylum seekers, rejecting the anti-migration policies and rhetoric prevalent across much of Europe.The decree, expected to come into effect in April, will apply to hundreds of thousands of asylum seekers and people in Spain with irregular status. To qualify for regularisation, applicants will have to prove they do not have a criminal record and had lived in Spain for at least five months – or had sought international protection – before 31 December 2025. Continue reading...
items.content: Move affecting those who have been in Spain five months or more runs counter to anti-migration policies across Europe Spain’s socialist-led coalition government has approved a decree it said would regularise 500,000 undocumented migrants and asylum seekers, rejecting the anti-migration policies and rhetoric prevalent across much of Europe.The decree, expected to come into effect in April, will apply to hundreds of thousands of asylum seekers and people in Spain with irregular status. To qualify for regularisation, applicants will have to prove they do not have a criminal record and had lived in Spain for at least five months – or had sought international protection – before 31 December 2025. Continue reading...

items.title: Spain plans to give half a million undocumented migrants legal status
items.standfirst: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.
items.content: The process will be available to foreign nationals without a criminal record who can prove they lived in Spain for five months prior to 31 December 2025.
